mods.abstract: A RUN-AWAY IN JAIL. WAS committed into the Prison of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 10th of January instant, a negroman calling himself REES , and saying he belongs to Demare & Sigue Treville, resididing at Cypre Mort, in the Parish of St. Mary, from whom he runaway about fifteen days ago. This boy is very black, 5 feet, 8 inches high, has a scar above his right eye, and has whiskers; speaks english only. The owner is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges, and take him away, otherwise he will be disposed of according to law. CHS. THOMPSON, Jailor. Opelousas, January 14th, 1854.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
